fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Current JIRA Software offers two options when releasing a version: 
* Ignore and proceed with the release _*or*_
* Move issues to version: _*later_version*_

The user will be able to release a version regardless of which option is chosen.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Add another option (checkbox) to the project settings for the *Version* component to allow (true - the above two as options) _*or*_ (false - to block the version from being released completely)

h3. *Why this is important*
 
To ensure the issues tied to the version is resolved no matter what or the version will not be released.
fields.summary: To block a version from being released if issue are not resolved

fields.description:
Currently we are working on a project and we are working on a Class system using #A to #D as identifying it's class. We are aware that there is a label system, however we prefer our own work method.

However, when using the search filter with the following searches: ''A'' ''a'' or ''#A'' There are no results.

How to reproduce:
 # Create a bug issue with #A in the title.
 # Post Bug
 # Select view all issues
 # Select Bug filter.
 # Make sure all other filters are disabled.
 # Search for your #A bug using either ''A'' ''a'' or ''#A''
 # Bug will not show up

I expect the search filter to detect my #A bug when I use the before mentioned searches.

It works for All other letters on the keyboard (NLD INTL)

 

Acceptance Criteria:

1. I can find my #A bug by typing ''A'' ''a'' or ''#A'' in the search filter
fields.summary: Cannot use search filter to search simply ''A'' ''a''' or ''#A''

fields.description:
Smart Commits are great, but unfortunately Smart Commits can be dangerous in some environments. Here is why:
h5. Fictional scenario 1: You're maintaining a product from the 90's called 'Don 3000'
 * Your Jira project has the key _DON3000_
 * The workflow has a transition called _Done_

h5. Fictional scenario 2: You are inventing R2D2
 * Your Jira project has the key _R2D2_
 * The workflow has a transition called _Resolve_

OK, there might be better product names or project keys, but the point is, that a project key might be a prefix of a transition name - if you ignore the digits in the project key...

What happens if someone commits with a message like this one:

 
{noformat}
Add awesomeness ref #DON3000-1, #DON3000-23{noformat}
According to [Using Smart Commits|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/using-smart-commits-in-bitbucket-server-802599018.html] nothing would happen, because the issue key is prefixed with '#'. Thus the developer is not referencing the issue key correctly.

 

But luckily Smart Commits is smart, because nowadays everyone is referring tickets with a hash symbol.

Even Atlassian uses the '#' notation in email notifications on the customer support portal:

 

 
{panel}
See request details and updates for [ #GHS-109386|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/20/GHS-109386?sda_source=notification-email] - "Unexpected smart commit behaviour"
{panel}
 

 

When I open the tickets DON3000-1 and DON3000-23, I see the commit in the development panel. Great!

But wait.... What happened?!?

The ticket DON3000-1 is now done! According to the activity panel, the commit closed DON3000-1. Well, that's unexpected!

 

I would say the hash notation for tickets are common and should not be considered as a bug. Jira and Bitbucket accept this notation and link issues with commit messages using this notation. But the command parsing of Smart Commits is really lousy.

 

Looking at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.devstatus.smartcommits.DefaultCommitMessageParser you know why:

 
{code:java}
private static final String COMMAND_TEXT = "([A-Za-z][A-Za-z\\-]*)";
private static final String COMMAND_EXTRACTION_PATTERN = NON_CAPTURING_WHITESPACE + "(?=#" + COMMAND_TEXT + ")";
{code}
The parser simply stops at the first character not being a letter or the dash character. If at least the pattern would allow digits... Can't transition names have digits?

 

Note: I haven't tested what happens if you extend the pattern for digits like "([A-Za-z][A-Za-z0-9\\-]*)", but if you accept any code contribution I would be happy to write some tests (maybe you already have some, tests are not part of the dependency sources... but that's another topic...)

 

Note: This bug is related to JRASERVER-60746 which would also solve this issue, but that issue might be considered as a feature, so that the lazy programmer only has to write #c instead of #close...

 

Final note: We have a client suffering from this issue. So it is not just a fictional edge case scenario. It does happen already and who knows how many issues have been closed or whatever by accident.

Final final note ;): Affects Version is probably every 7.x version. I just tested it on my own test instance which had version 7.5.3.

Argh: I think this is a bug and would like to file it here, but your instance is broken:
 # Creating a bug ticket for project JRASERVER is unusabe as you provide no description field or other multiline textfield
 # Creating a bug ticket for project JSWSERVER fails on submission complaining that my user does not have the 'Assign Issue' permission
 # I'll try submitting it as a "Suggestion" - please consider it as a bug and let me know if you're taking care of it. Otherwise feel free to close it immediately and say something like "we don't care".
fields.summary: Smart Commits may unexpectedly execute transition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when the number of characters on the lengthiest rank field on the {{AO_60DB71_LEXORANK}} table exceeds:
* 50 characters: a rebalance operation is scheduled to occur in 12 hours;
* 100 characters: a rebalance operation is immediately started;
See related KB [Troubleshooting new ranking system issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-new-ranking-system-issues-779159221.html]

That will lead to the following:
* Lexorank rebalance job will balance whole space for RANK and that means touching all issues. 
* For large instance this might take significant time (days). 

In some cases, those long RANK values are localised in small area and there is no need to rebalance whole space.  
For example, there is a problem only around space _hz_ :
{noformat}
1|zzzzzz: 
1|w00000:                     
1|hzzzzz:                             
1|hzzzzy:zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzy
1|hzzzzy:zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzw
1|hzzzzy:zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzr
1|i00000:
{noformat}
In majority cases there are problem with a couple of thousands rows only, while whole table has millions rows. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option for Lexorank rebalancing task for localize those areas and rebalance only them.
That will significantly reduce length of rebalancing (from days to minutes). As a consequence it reduce load for Jira. 
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Add option to do local Lexorank rebalancing

fields.description:
Priority Schemes are a nice new feature everybody was waiting for a long time to get. But the current implementation is suboptimal.

1.) Assigning Priority Schemes to Projects

Actually, it is the only thing where it's the other way around. You don't assign Priority Scheme to Products like with every other Scheme, no you assign Products to Priority Schemes. To change a projects Priority Scheme you have to go to the Priority Scheme and link the project in a multi-select box where I can see 5 of x-hundred project entries. If I don't hold down CMD while editing this form the whole configuration is gone.

Please change it the way you assign everything else to a project. A button [Switch Priority Scheme] and a Dropdown with all existing Priority Schemes.

 

2.) Creating new Priority Schemes

If you create new priorities like DefCon1 to DefCon5 they are automatically added to the default Priority Scheme, that is linked to all projects by default. But you can't edit the Default Priority Scheme to remove the newly created priorities. So you have to create a new "Custom Default" Priority Scheme assign all projects and then you can add new priorities.

This is completely unnecessary. Please make the Default Priority Scheme editable. Or don't add new priorities to it in the first place.
fields.summary: Priorits Scheme refinements

fields.description:
*Context*

We're mid-way through Sprint 5 of this project that I'm IM'ing in JIRA and we're trying to put a scope histogram together showing how total scope has changed over the past few sprints. It's not easy! Which does beg the question: why is it so hard to determine total project scope at points in the past? In my view, this is a basic feature of a project burn-up and I don't think it should take Excel or a script to get at this data. 

The closest I have found is the Release Burndown, which does not give a value for total scope, and the Version Report, which doesn't tell you the scope total at any point, you have to try to deduce it by visually scanning left to the Y-axis, which isn't a perfect value (nor is the X-axis as dates are varied and don't line up with sprint start dates). 

Seems to me it would be a fairly simple enhancement to add the Total Scope value to the Release Burndown, since that report already does some tallying of totals at the sprint starts. 

Does this suggestion belong in this backlog or in Greenhopper? I'm not sure.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to calculate TOTAL PROJECT SCOPE at past sprint start dates so that I can visually demonstrate to my stakeholders scope fluctuations over time.

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary
* Split functionality shows error when editing the Remaining estimate of the parent issue, specifically a 'Story'.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sprint, without starting it.
# Add 'Story' issues to the sprint.
# Go to Backlog, on one of the issues in the new sprint, right click  and choose the option 'Split issue' !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
# On the pop-up change the remaining estimate of the Parent issue and click out of the 'Remaining' textbox.

h5. Expected Behavior
* You are able to continue writing other information and split the issue.

h5. Actual Behavior
* You get an error :  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! which, after expanding shows this:  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Cause
* Unknown.

h5. Workaround
* None

h5. Notes:
* Browser independent.
* After receiving the error, you are still able to split the issue, but it is unclear what effect does this error have.
fields.summary: Split functionality shows error when editing the Remaining estimate of the parent issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Smart Commit Error when Issue Key Doesn't Exist on Instance
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect JIRA and Bitbucket together with application link and enable smart commits
 # Ensure you have a username and email that matches on both instances.
 # Enable outbound email on JIRA
 # Create a git commit that references an issue key that doesn't exist on the JIRA instance and and uses some additional action such as {{#comment}} or {{#time}}

h3. Expected Results
 - JIRA will ignore the smart commit in cases where the issue key doesn't exist

h3. Actual Results

JIRA will send an email to the user performing the commit with the following messaging:

{quote}
There was an error processing your smart commit
 Commit Icon
 450bb68
 Tuesday, February 20, 2018 3:00:12 PM CET 
 Due to the following errors we could not process your smart commit. You need to perform the action on the issue manually.
 1 command created an error
{quote}

!smart_commit.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

For environments where multiple JIRA instances are connected to Bitbucket with the same user bases this will result in unnecessary failure emails. These confuse users and drive support calls.

h3. Workaround

none at this time, except for client-side email filtering.
fields.summary: JIRA Smart Commit Error when Issue Key Doesn't Exist on Instance

h4. Summary
Converting days to weeks in Control Chart disregards working days configuration.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Have issue in the Kanban board which was in certain status (lets say In Progress) status from Jan 3rd to Feb 20th (total of 34 working days)
# Configure board to have 5 working days only
!workingdays.png|thumbnail!
# Refer to Control Chart report > choose status *In Progress*

h4. Expected Result
The time duration will be shown as 6 weeks 4 days, as the total working days is divided by 5 (working days configured in a week)

h4. Actual Result
The time duration is shown as 4 weeks 6 days, the total working days is divided by 7 
!controlchart.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Converting days to weeks in Control Chart disregards working days configuration

fields.description:
If you use have a Workflow Scheme that uses the _jira_ workflow for all/some Issue Types, you are not able to drag and drop issues in a Sprint.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a new Workflow Scheme and associate all issue types with the _jira_ workflow.
# Associate this new scheme to your project.
# Go to the Scrum Board and try to drag and drop issues.

You will also notice that if you navigate to Board Configuration and try to map the statuses, they will be there with the following warning in the HTML _tooltip_: _This status is not available in any of the workflows used by this board. To remove, drag it to unmapped statuses where it will no longer be available._
Note that this will only be displayed if the _jira_ workflow is the only associated on that scheme. If you have more than one workflow, then no warning will be displayed and only issues that are using the _jira_ workflow will work.

h3. Expected results

Jira should allow you to use that workflow, especially since when copying that workflow and not making any changes, it works just fine.

h3. Actual Results

When using the _jira_ workflow, you are not able to drag and drop issues from one status to another in an active sprint.

h3. Additional information

This could be related to the fact that the _jira_ workflow is hardcoded to the system and does not show in the {{jiraworkflows}} table, so it is possible that the code is looking for an existing workflow and not finding one.
fields.summary: Drag and drop in an Active Sprint does not work when using the jira workflow

Our security department has scanned our Jira (v7.4.2#74004-sha1:586975d) using an IBM tool called Appscan.  It reported a possible vulnerability.  I have to prepare a response to indicate if this is a known problem and when or if it will be fixed.  I require your assistance please. Text from the report follows:
 # *Missing Secure Attribute in Encrypted Session (SSL) Cookie*- It may be possible to steal user and session information (cookies) that was sent during an encrypted session.

 _Recommendation_:  Add the 'Secure' attribute to all sensitive cookies.
fields.summary: Missing Secure Attribute in Encrypted Session (SSL) Cookie

fields.description:
Our security department has scanned our Jira (v7.4.2#74004-sha1:586975d) using an IBM tool called Appscan.  It reported a possible vulnerability.  I have to prepare a response to indicate if this is a known problem and when or if it will be fixed.  I require your assistance please. Text from the report follows:
 # *Cross-Site Request Forgery*. It may be possible to steal or manipulate customer session and cookies, which might be used to impersonate a legitimate user, allowing the hacker to view or alter user records, and to perform transactions as that user. The test result seems to indicate a vulnerability because the test response is identical to the original response, indicating that the Cross Site Request Forgery attempt was successful, even though it included a fictive “Referer” header.

_Recommendation_: Validate the value of the "Referer" header, and use a one-time-nonce for each submitted form. !image-2018-02-15-08-46-25-932.png!
fields.summary: Cross-Site Request Forgery

*Summary*

Link feature does not allow to search for Confluence page on Kanban and Scrum boards.

 

*Steps to reproduce*

Pre-condition. Jira and Confluence are installed and app links for both are configured correctly.
 # Navigate to agile board
 # Click on issue
 # Use More->Link
 # Navigate to _Confluence Page_ inside issue link dialog
 # Put any test and attempt to search for a page.

*Results*

No results are found

 

*Expected results*

Relevant pages display in search results.

 

 

*Workaround*

Use search functionality on an issue details view.

 

*Notes*
{quote}If we try to link a confluence page to a jira issue while on a Kanban or JIRA Software (agile) board and attempt to search for a page, it doesn't pull up the search screen. Clicking on the link for "search for a page" does not do anything.

This has been replicated on support VMs, the link just does not work.

It does work however on the issue page itself.
{quote}

fields.description:
{panel:title=User Story}
As a scrum team member, I want to be able to add more than one avatar icon to one card, to indicate that more people are working on this card.
{panel}
The request for having more than one assignee has been made a couple of years ago (see links). All of them got rejected, due to the policy, that Jira sicks with 1 assignee.

My request is not to break this, but to add a functionality to the agile board only, that for example, the username behind an avatar is part of a user picker (multi users) custom field. The assignee can stay as it is (first drag&drop of avatar will fill assignee, next goes into custom field).

During the past years, working as an agile coach, I have seen many times that teams, working with a physical agile board, mark issues with multiple avatars (magnetic white-board, post-its and individual magnetic avatars).

It absolutely make sense, because the whole agile movement is all about "individuals and their interaction". +Reviews+, +knowledge transfer+ and +pair programming+ (XP) are best examples for marking an issue with more than one worker. Not only the solo work on one issue.

Implementing this feature will make Jira Software come very close to the physical boards.
fields.summary: More than one avatar on an agile card

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when you have the following directory configuration:
{code}
JIRA > Crowd > Active Directory/LDAP
{code}
# Then you perform a user renaming in AD/LDAP side
# Sync Crowd to receive latest changes from AD/LDAP side (do not sync JIRA yet)
# New username tries to connect
# JIRA will then checks the Crowd directory and sees that it exists in Crowd directory
# JIRA will creates a new username instead

The problem is that when you update a username, you either have to wait x minutes (could be a long time depending on your settings) for the next scheduled sync or either have to manually sync JIRA to Crowd. If for some reason a user tries to connect during this period, it will create a new account and you'll have to modify his username to the old one, log in again then perform the username change a second time in order not to lose his history.

h3. Suggested Solution
# New username tries to connect
# JIRA checks the Crowd directory and sees that it exists in crowd directory
# JIRA checks if external_ID value already exists in JIRA DB (that's the unique identifier mapped in Crowd as "User unique identifier attribute").
# If it does exist => JIRA updates the username of the existing account, if it doesn't exist => JIRA creates a new user
fields.summary: better detection of user renaming changes when JIRA is connecting to Crowd

h3. Summary

Issue is related to JRASERVER-62851. Currently, JIRA's default setting for jira.search.maxclauses is 65000. If JIRA has more than this amount in Unreleased Versions, boards will break with this error in the logs:

{code}
2018-02-06 11:48:37,512 http-nio-8080-exec-249 ERROR admin 708x7171733x2 m2if96 192.168.1.2,127.0.0.1 /rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/work/allData.json [c.a.g.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl] A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {fixVersion in unreleasedVersions()}
com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseTooComplexSearchException: A the following query was too complex to generate a query from: {fixVersion in unreleasedVersions()}
	at com.atlassian.jira.jql.query.DefaultLuceneQueryBuilder.createLuceneQuery(DefaultLuceneQueryBuilder.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:203)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider.search(LuceneSearchProvider.java:114)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1973.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy184.search(Unknown Source)
	... 2 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:136)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy184.search(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.findImpl(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:166)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.issue.IssueDataServiceImpl.findWithServiceOutcome(IssueDataServiceImpl.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkDataFactory.getWorkDataIssueCountAndLastUpdated(WorkDataFactory.java:213)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkDataFactory.getAllData(WorkDataFactory.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource$1.call(WorkResource.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource$1.call(WorkResource.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.util.RestCall.response(RestCall.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.createResponse(AbstractResource.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.AbstractResource.response(AbstractResource.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.work.WorkResource.getPoolData(WorkResource.java:58)
	... 2 filtered
{code}


h3. Environment

JIRA 7.6.2, 7.7.0


h3. Expected Results

JIRA open the board without any error.


h3. Actual Results

JIRA throws *Error readin issue data* when user tries to access the board.


h3.Workaround
See possible workarounds:
* Delete _Kanban board sub-filter_ if you don't need versions
* If you need version, add specific project(s) related to JQL filter for the board into *unreleasedVersions* function
{code:borderStyle=solid}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions(ProjA, ProjB) OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{code}
* Release/archive versions until the system is under the 65000 limit
* (!) Not recommended. Increase the default limit of 65000, but it is not known how this will affect future performance of the system. This can be done by increasing the value for jira.search.maxclauses in *jira-application.properties* file located in following directory:
{code}
<JIRA-INSTALL-DIRECTORY><atlassian-jira>/WEB-INF/classes/
{code}
** (!)  It is not known how this will affect future performance of the system.

There is no workaround at this time.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Ranking operations are not possible on an issue if the issue has a Rank value with a length greater than 254 characters. Attempts to rank the issue will fail with errors such as the following:

{code}2018-01-12 22:18:37,740 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 WARN      [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] Unable to retrieve rank for field [15200] and issue [3867884]
2018-01-12 22:18:37,740 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 WARN      [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankCFType] gh.api.rank.error.lexorank.fieldlength.exceeded.norebalance
2018-01-12 22:18:37,740 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 WARN      [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer] Could not retrieve LexoRank value for issue[id=3867884]. Indexing max LexoRank value instead.{code}

Issues will not be rankable again until a rebalance is complete, which can take a prohibitive amount of time depending on the size of the instance.

This is a static value configured in the source code of JIRA and cannot be adjusted in the UI, nor can it be configured through any configuration files or startup arguments.

As instances grow, the likelihood of encountering this rank length limit increases. In certain cases, and only under careful consideration from the administrators, it would be helpful to be allowed to adjust this value to a higher number to work around the limitation while the rebalance proceeds. Alternatively, it would be helpful to be allowed to bypass the limitation.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Allow for administrators to be able to configure the maximum rank length via the UI, or at least via a configuration that can be set upon restarting JIRA.
* Or, allow administrators to bypass the rank limit in order to be able to continue ranking issues while the balance is ongoing.

h3. Why this is important
 
Larger instances can face balance times of days, or even weeks. If this rank length limit is encountered, users will be unable to rank issues until the balance is complete. Administrators need a way to mitigate this.

h3. Notes

It is worth noting that in instances that are frequently finding that their rank length is reaching the limit threshold, increasing the rank length would only be a workaround. To address the root cause and decrease the frequency when this occurs:
* [JSWSERVER-16466 : Jira Agile getRankRelativeToOtherIssue() method allocate next Rank very inefficiently in some cases|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16466]
fields.summary: Allow for Lexorank Maximum Rank Length to be configured by Administrators

fields.description:
I cloned this issue from JSWSERVER-10494 because, while Martin J clarified in March 2014 that this is expected behaviour, I challenge the decision to "[...] only show the name when there are more than one available transition/status in the column [...]".

@bleddyn.raw-rees did a great job of summarizing the use-case for different behaviour in his comment on the original issue:
{quote}Hi,

We would actually find it very useful if the transitions were labeled in the column even if there was only a single transition. 

The reason being, for example, we have three transitions going to the final _Done_ status. These all have different resolutions, _Rejected, No longer required,_ and _Done._ Ideally, these transitions should all occur from different points in the work flow but I've found myself putting extra transitions in just to make it clear to the user which transition it is they're using. 

Being able to select the option to have the transition label appear in the column all of the time (a check box on the board configuration screen perhaps?) would be amazing. Is there anyway of achieving this that you're aware of? Otherwise are you aware of anyone raising this already because I can't believe that I'm the only one - but I haven't been able to find it. 

Any help/suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Kind regards,

Bleddyn
{quote}

Please reconsider this behaviour - offering some choice on when labels are shown through a toggle or a transition property would be a great improvement, and likely the default behaviour could simply be changed, to the benefit of most users.
fields.summary: Show transition name on single-transition columns

h3. Workaround
Don't use expand all, but use combination of desired expand values
I.e. any of "permissions,user,group,projectRole,field,all"
E.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/project/JRA/permissionscheme?expand=field
fields.summary: REST API for Permission Scheme Throws a NullPointerException

Currently, some custom fields would appear under the "People" or "Date" grouping on the right section of an issue view screen.

Suggested Solution
We would want there to be a way to add another group, for example, "Administration" group which is a section that can be configured to contain a few custom fields related to the group.

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, a scrum master can create one sprint at a time.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to create sprint in bulk. For example, specifying 5 sprints where each sprint will take 2 weeks. By specifying the start date of the first sprint, JIRA will automatically complete the sprint and start the next sprint at the auto-specified date.
fields.summary: Having the option to bulk create sprints

fields.description:
Recently sprint goals were an added feature, and they are awesome.

However I'm wondering if there could be more visibility for them.

Like a confluence macro for meeting notes that shows the current sprint goals, or it could be displayed very large on the active sprints board of the sprint.

Right now it's just a little but too small to do anything with and becomes forgettable.

{code}
h3. *Investigation*
 # So far it seems to not affect any functionalities.
 # There is a similar bug traced in JSWSERVER-15307
 # However, differing from JSWSERVER-15307, the problem is coming from the Issue View Screen. JSWSERVER-15307's problem is coming from View Board Screen.

h3. *Workaround*

Jira Administrators can hide logging on the package by increasing logging level to ERROR.

You can achieve this by adding these lines into *log4j.properties*:
{code:java}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.ozymandias  = ERROR, console, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.ozymandias = false
{code}
For changes to make an effect, Jira restart is required.

The file log4j.properties is located at JIRA_INSTALL_DIR/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes (as of Jira 7.12.x)

(on) Mind, this would make the log lines disappear, yet would not address the root cause.
 The actual case had to be addressed by the plug-in vendor.
h3. *For Plug-in Vendors*

*Background*

atlassian-ozymandias is used to unify interaction Jira with the plug-ins.

From the internal documentation:
{quote}While any piece of code can be made safe by try/catches, as we all know, try/catch handling is verbose in Java.

Ozymandias attempts to codify a standard call pattern and logging response to runtime exceptions.

*What safety is applied*

The ozymandias code catches all RuntimeExceptions and a handful of Errors that indicate code versioning problems, such as java.lang.LinkageError. It then logs a single line at warning level and logs the stack trace at debug level. This is a balance between knowing that a bit of code has problems and over-whelming the logs with stack traces.
{quote}
*Finding the errors*
{quote}*Getting low level errors*
 If you are really interested in what went wrong, then many methods return List<Option<? extends ModuleAccessError>> and other variations.
{code:java}
List<Option<? extends ModuleAccessError>> errList = SafePluginPointAccess.to().descriptors(descriptorList, visitor);{code}
There will be an Option.none() for every successful access and an Option.some() of ModuleAccessError for every one that failed.
{quote}
Additional tips for plug-in vendors:
 * use DEBUG level on com.atlassian.ozymandias to get stacktrace details
 * use debugger on the classes from the package, i.e. SafePluginPointAccess to see interactions with the plug-in.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Agile Board configuration page fails to load due to longer JQL query execution (a query takes longer than 60s default JSON timeout)
h3. Steps To Reproduce

Configure board with long and complex JQL, with an execution longer than the 60s.
h3. Expected Results
 * The board should continue loading anyway
or
 * A meaningful warning/error message should be displayed with related reason:
 ** default timeout information
 ** long JQL execution
 ** other root cause

h3. Actual Results

The board does not load, no effective error message provided to the user.
h3. Workaround
Some recommendations and workaround are available in the KB:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-default-ajax-timeout-in-jira-824345485.html]
fields.summary: Agile Board configuration page load timeouts due to long JQL execution

fields.description:
Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA Project Admin is able to assign project users and make them as project admin. This may cause audit issue for some of the application users. 

Suggested Solution
Allow admin to customize project admin permission instead of presetting with a list of permission.

Workaround
There is no workaround available.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Admin to customize Project Admin Permission

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* Create a board
* Create a sprint (but do not start it)
* Create an issue on the board and assign it to the Sprint
* Configure a Workflow with the {{jira.issue.editable = false}} property on the closed status
* Configure a postfunction to trigger the {{Issue Closed}} event on the close transition
* Trigger the {{Close}} transition
* The Sprint field will be removed from the issue entirely. This does not happen when you have any other event configured, or not the editable property set up
fields.summary: Sprint field removed on specific transition when using jira.issue.editable = false and Issue Closed event

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Various DoD entities may encounter the inability to open or save the Excel exports produced by JIRA. As security technical implementation guide for Excel is implemented, the current Excel export file type of "Web Pages and Excel 2003 XML Spreadsheets" will be blocked in the Trust Center's 'File Block Settings'.

A desired feature would be for a formatted export that does not contain web elements. Exports are terrific for distribution for the many stakeholders who do not have or need Jira accounts.
fields.summary: Current Excel export will be blocked on DoD systems

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA does not enforce unique Epic Name for each Epic. This could cause confusion when users try to add Epic Name to issue and JIRA could have suggest more than one Epic with same Epic Name.


h3. Suggested Solution

Enforce unique Epic Name for each Epic

h3. Workaround 

None
